name: Transit Gateway - Cheat.txt - Introduction
description: This section introduces the concept of AWS Transit Gateway, which is a centralized network hub that simplifies connectivity between Virtual Private Clouds (VPCs) and on-premises networks. It acts as a cloud router, eliminating the need for complex peering relationships by allowing new connections to be made only once. Transit Gateway can scale elastically based on network traffic volume, and Inter-Region peering enables connecting Transit Gateways across different AWS Regions using the AWS global network.
use_cases: Connecting multiple VPCs and on-premises networks through a central hub
Simplifying network architecture and reducing complex peering relationships
Enabling elastic scaling based on network traffic volume
Facilitating Inter-Region connectivity between Transit Gateways

use_cases: Enabling communication between different resources or components within a cloud environment

Implementing a centralized networking hub for managing and controlling network traffic

name: Transit Gateway - Cheat.txt - Attachments: We can attach the following
description: This section outlines the various components that can be attached to a Transit Gateway, which acts as a central hub for interconnecting different network resources. It allows connecting Virtual Private Clouds (VPCs), Direct Connect Gateways for on-premises connectivity, other Transit Gateways through peering, and VPN Connections for secure remote access.
use_cases: Centralized network connectivity and routing between VPCs
Hybrid cloud connectivity with on-premises data centers
Secure remote access for remote users or sites
Interconnecting multiple Transit Gateways for large-scale networking

name: Transit Gateway - Cheat.txt - Transit Gateway Route Table:
description: This section explains that a Transit Gateway has a default route table, and it can have additional route tables. By default, all Transit Gateway attachments (such as VPCs or VPNs) are associated with the default route table. This allows for routing traffic between the attached resources through the Transit Gateway.
use_cases: Routing traffic between VPCs and on-premises networks
Centralized routing for hybrid cloud architectures
Simplifying network management by using a single routing table

name: Transit Gateway - Cheat.txt - Associations:
description: This section likely explains the concept of 'Associations' in the context of Transit Gateway, which is a networking service provided by cloud providers like AWS. Associations refer to the connections or links established between different resources or components within the Transit Gateway architecture. This allows for efficient routing and communication between various network components, enabling seamless integration and connectivity across different environments.
use_cases: Connecting Virtual Private Clouds (VPCs) to the Transit Gateway
Establishing communication between on-premises data centers and cloud resources
Enabling secure and efficient data transfer between different AWS regions or accounts
Facilitating hybrid cloud deployments by integrating on-premises infrastructure with cloud resources
capabilities: Associating Direct Connect gateways or VPNs with Transit Gateway
Configuring routing tables and route propagation
Providing centralized network management and monitoring
Supporting high availability and fault tolerance

name: Transit Gateway - Cheat.txt - Route Propagation:
description: This section explains how different network resources (VPCs, VPN connections, Direct Connect gateways, and peering attachments) can propagate routes to a Transit Gateway route table. It describes the different mechanisms used by each resource to propagate routes, such as dynamic propagation using BGP for VPN connections and Direct Connect gateways, and static routes for VPCs and peering attachments.
use_cases: Connecting VPCs to on-premises networks via Transit Gateway
Establishing hybrid cloud connectivity using Transit Gateway
Enabling communication between VPCs through Transit Gateway peering attachments
Centralized routing and traffic control using Transit Gateway route tables
